Hero.4: Search For Data Sets, Visualisations Etc.

insights.sub_title: Showcasing and visualizing the interactive urban related informations through different level of perspective.
insights.national_desc: Malaysia is a Southeast Asian country divided into two regions: Peninsular Malaysia and Borneo East Malaysia.
insights.regional_desc: Malaysia is divided into six main regions, namely the Northern Region, Central Region, Southern Region, East Coast, Sabah, and Sarawak.
insights.state_desc: Malaysia consists of 13 states and 3 federal territories.
insights.local_desc: Malaysia consists of 155 local authorities. All authorities are responsible for public facilities and basic infrastructure, while city authorities generally also provide services such as public health, waste management and urban planning, and city councils in turn provide law enforcement.

themes.sub_title: 5 themes used in MUO towards urban sustainability
themes.sustainable_desc: This theme emphasises the monitoring aspect of sustainable physical development by considering each development's geographical position. It includes elements of infrastructure and utilities, urban mobility, accessibility, rural development, urban diversity, and land use.
themes.dynamic_balanced_desc: This theme will emphasise on monitoring aspects of economic growth across the country covering economic resilience and competitiveness. It also focuses on the digital economy's development and food security issues that can jeopardize the economic balance.
themes.livable_environment_desc: On the aspects of monitoring community wellbeing, it includes sub-themes of housing planning, education, health, security, human capital development and community involvement in development that can improve the quality of life.
themes.environment_desc: Environmental monitoring includes aspects of sustainable land use planning, conservation and preservation of the environment and heritage resources, and disaster risk management that can assist in addressing climate change.
themes.governance_desc: The good governance theme will cover aspects of good governance monitoring and planning towards enhancing transparency and accountability. It includes legislation, financial distribution, asset management, public involvement in planning activities and the capacity of an institution.

modules.sub_title: Main Modules in Malaysia Urban Observatory (MUO)
modules.sustainable_urban_desc: A module that reports on the achievements of the implementation of national and international sustainability agendas such as Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), National Urbanization Policy (DPN) or National Physical Plan (RFN).
modules.geo_hub_desc: Accessible data-sharing hub. This module provides an online information sharing platform for professionals to general readers.
modules.dashboard_desc: The platform provides a wide range of features and functionalities, including geo-analytics and a smart dashboard that is user friendly and easy to share.
modules.city_proile_desc: Offer interactive story maps, dashboards and visualisations that encompass physical issues like land usage and urban settlement, among others.
modules.research_desc: Assist diverse stakeholders in implementing research procedures and developing and testing models linked to municipal research and development.
modules.decision_desc: Allows users to easily perform analysis and analysis. Before being included in the MUO analysis, this module can adjust the criteria, models, algorithms or formulas used in the research and development module to achieve a high level of accuracy.
modules.national_smart_desc: Facilitate in the analysis of data and information from numerous sources to create more effective data-driven decisions linked to urban development and management.
modules.mobile_app_desc: MUO application software for easy access to MUO information via mobile devices, such as smartphones or tablet computers

disclaimer.title: DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.message: All information published and contained in this website is for general reference purposes only. PLANMalaysia does not guarantee that any information contained in this website is complete, up-to-date or accurate. The information displayed is subject to change without notice. For the purpose of verifying information, you are advised to check with PLANMalaysia State or Local Authorities.

w3c.title: W3C : Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (Disability Access )
w3c.desc1: PLANMalaysia's Official Portal provides facilities for disabled access (OKU) / Disability Access based on W3C standards.
w3c.desc2: - Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) following the procedure of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0.

sectionA.title: A) VISUALLY IMPAIRED USERS
sectionA.desc: Get the free ChromeVox component (extension) software for the Google Chrome web browser here for the purpose of reading the text content of this website in the form of audio (audio) conversation (in English).
sectionA.point1: 1. Before you can use this component, you need to install it on Google Chrome as an extension and before that you have to download and install Google Chrome web browser software.
sectionA.point2: 2. For further instructions to use this component, please click here.
sectionA.point3: 3. Alternatively, you can also use at least one Speech Engine or Text/Screen Reader or Text-to-speech (TTS) software. Speech engine is a male or female voice, which will speak in English or other languages ​​according to your choice. Another example of software that can be used is Microsoft Narrator available in Windows 8/7/Vista and Microsoft components (Chrome extension).Microsoft.

sectionB.title: B) Color blind users
sectionB.desc: For color blind users, there are several color options available at the top of each page of the Malaysia Urban Observatory Official Portal. Users can choose a color from the color options provided and the color of the text on the Official Malaysia Urban Observatory Portal will change according to your choice.

sectionC.title: C) Elderly users or have near / far sightedness
sectionC.desc: For this category, the Official Malaysia Urban Observatory Portal provides the facility to choose different text sizes. The text size options are displayed in the upper column of each PLANMalaysia Official Portal page. Users can choose whether to choose a larger or smaller text size, as appropriate.

sectionD.title: D) Users with hand and foot disabilities or nerve motor control problems / sense of touch (motor and dexterity impairments)
sectionD.point1: 1. This portal can be navigated without using a mouse device, i.e. just using the keyboard by pressing the Tab button and arrows to move around the spaces and elements of the website interface and pressing the Enter or Spacebar button to select an interface element to interact with or as a link to another web page content page.
sectionD.point2: 2. This portal can also be navigated using a mouse device only, assisted by available software
sectionD.point3: 3. This portal can also be navigated and accessed by sound (audio) using a microphone device, in the form of English speaking instructions using Speech Recognition software (tools) or at least Speech-to-text using Assistive Technology technology) such as Windows Speech Recognition software and component software (Chrome extension)

sectionE.title: References / Links :
sectionE.point1: 1) W3C , Standards , Web Design and Applications , Accessibility : http://www.w3.org/standards/webdesign/accessibility

footer.notes: Best view using Mozilla Firefox version 50 and above at minimum screen resolution of 1366x768

privacySection1.title: YOUR PRIVACY
privacySection1.desc: This page describes the privacy policy that covers the use and protection of information provided by visitors. If you make a transaction or send an email that contains a personal notice, this notice may be shared with other public agencies to help provide more efficient and effective service. For example, in resolving complaints that require feedback from other agencies.

privacySection2.title: NOTICE OF DATA COLLECTED
privacySection2.desc: No personal information will be collected while you browse this portal except the information sent by you via email.
privacySection2.point1: This Portal has links to other portals/webpages. This privacy policy applies to this web page only. Please be advised that the portals/webpages listed in the links may have different privacy policies and visitors are advised to research and understand the privacy policies for each portal/webpage they navigate.

privacySection3.title: BASIC CHANGES
privacySection3.desc: If this privacy policy is scanned, the scan will be updated on this page. By regularly visiting this page, you will be updated with the information collected, how it is used and in certain circumstances, how the information is shared with others.

privacySection4.title: PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION
privacySection4.point1: The Personal Data Protection Office (JPDP) is an agency under the Ministry of Communications and Multimedia Malaysia (KKMM) that was established on 16 May 2011 after Parliament passed the Draft Law related to the Personal Data Protection Act (APDP) 2010, which is the Act 709.
privacySection4.point2: The main responsibility of this position is to supervise the processing of personal data of individuals involved in commercial business affairs by Data Users so that they are not abused and misused by interested parties.
privacySection4.point3: The security of the user's personal data needs to be protected to prevent any form of misuse of the storage or processing of individual, public and private personal data in Malaysia in commercial transactions as stipulated under this APDP.
privacySection4.point4: In empowering APDP, JPDP has required all Personal Data User Groups consisting of individuals and private parties except the Government to register officially for the purpose of protecting the rights of users and the public.
privacySection4.point5: JPDP is chaired by the Head of the Driving Committee assisted by the Chief Driving Officer. Meanwhile, there are three main divisions in the JPDP, namely the Registration and Operations Division, the Monitoring Division and the Legal Division.

securitySection1.title: DATA PROTECTION
securitySection1.desc: The latest technology including data encryption is used to protect the data presented and adherence to strict security standards is used to prevent unauthorized gains.

securitySection2.title: SAFETY STORE
securitySection2.desc: All electronic storage and transmission of personal data will be protected and stored using appropriate security technologies.

aboutmuo1.title: WHAT IS MUO?
aboutmuo1.desc: Malaysia Urban Observatory (MUO) is a municipal monitoring system at the national level that integrates various big data platforms to carry out analytical data functions so that the urban data management system is more comprehensive, inclusive and effective to achieve sustainable development for the well-being of the community.

aboutmuo2.title: GOAL OF MUO
aboutmuo2.desc: Aims to be a national platform of big data analytics for spatial planning through a smart integrated information network

aboutmuo3.title: OBJECTIVES OF MUO
aboutmuo3.point1: Develop an innovative system that automatically collects, generates and analyzes data
aboutmuo3.poiint2: Develops data centers from a variety of data technology-based sources which related to urban and rural planning
aboutmuo3.point3: Monitoring of sustainability based on the achievement of national and international sustainability agenda
aboutmuo3.point4: Focus on the implementation of innovative technology solutions through geo-analytical
aboutmuo3.point5: Develop a network for information exchange and capacity building

aboutmuo4.title: MUO FUNCTIONS
aboutmuo4.point1: A comprehensive and holistic urban big data platform
aboutmuo4.point2: Monitoring and implementation of the sustainability agenda

aboutmuo5.title: COLLABORATION PARTNERS
aboutmuo5.point2: Key stakeholders with expertise in digital infrastructure readiness and hardware and open data sharing platforms in support of MUO development
aboutmuo5.point4: Stakeholders who supply and use data through the MUO platform

aboutnscp1.title: NATIONAL SMART CITY PLATFORM
aboutnscp1.desc: The National Smart City Platform is an integrated platform at the national level that integrates smart city data and municipal information to create smart city data.

aboutnscp2.title: OBJECTIVES OF THE NATIONAL SMART CITY PLATFORM
aboutnscp2.desc: The National Smart City Platform as a network of smart city information and data sharing with Local Authorities to deal with municipal issues

aboutnscp3.title: OBJECTIVES OF THE NATIONAL SMART CITY PLATFORM
aboutnscp3.point1: Facilitating the sharing of municipal data / information online in real time through different sources / platforms to create the country smart urban data.
aboutnscp3.point2: Help analyze data / information from various different sources to make data-driven decision making (data driven decision making) more efficiently related to urban development and management.
aboutnscp3.point3: Monitor and measure the implementation and achievements of cities in Malaysia in the implementation of smart city initiatives (in accordance with ISO 37122) to be on par with cities at the international level.
aboutnscp3.point4: Support the planning and implementation of the Malaysian Smart City Framework 2019-2025 which has identified Policies, Strategies and Initiatives to meet the National direction to make cities in Malaysia more competitive and reporting to the National Smart City Council.
aboutnscp3.point5: Monitoring the implementation of smart cities involving 155 PBTs through the Malaysian Smart City profiling dashboard as a guide to the Ministry in planning and monitoring the implementation of smart city projects/initiatives in Malaysia more systematically.

aboutnscp5.title: NATIONAL SMART CITY COMPONENTS
aboutnscp5.desc: There are seven component of Smart City which include:

national1.title: Malaysia World Ranking
national1.infointro: This feature displays Malaysia's position in the world in many sectors such as econ
national1.info: mi, technology, business, education, culture and science, which has been compiled using reliable open data sources. The statistics show Malaysia's position in all areas around the world, and it also provides an overview of Malaysia's performance compared to other countries with the same sector.

Success.submit: Your Complaint has been submitted. Thank you

ContactUs.name: Name
ContactUs.desc: If you have any other queries or questions, please fill out the following form to contact us. Thank you.

faq.title: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
faq.A1: Malaysia Urban Observatory (MUO) becomes a big data analytics platform that applies an integrated smart information system (Integrated Smart Information System) to support sustainable urban development. MUO is the basic framework for developing the municipal information sharing network and the National Smart City Platform.
faq.Q2: What are the requirements of the Malaysia Urban Observatory (MUO) system ?
faq.A21: Achieving global urban development goals through comparison with the achievements of other cities in the world.
faq.A22: Evaluate urbanization trends in Malaysia comprehensively and improve monitoring of sustainable urban development indicators.
faq.A23: Enable more accurate and simple planning decisions with a platform for analysis to deal with increasingly complex urban issues.
faq.A24: The final result of the analysis will be significant as an input to formulate a city development strategy.
faq.A25: Management and sharing of data and information is becoming more efficient.
faq.Q3: What is the role of the MUO system ?
faq.A3: The MUO system as a spatial planning analytics big data platform through an integrated intelligent information sharing network.
faq.Q4: What are the benefits of using the MUO system ?
faq.A4: Users can understand and share existing data in the MUO system.
faq.Q5: How many modules are there in the MUO System platform ?
faq.A5: There are 8 modules in the MUO system which is:
faq.Q6: Which modules are involved in creating data sharing and service maps ?
faq.A6: The modules involved are City Profile module and the Research and Development Module
faq.Q7: Who are the collaborators involved in the MUO System ?
faq.A7: Collaboration Partners consist of Strategic Partners and Smart Partners. Strategic Partners are key stakeholders with expertise in digital infrastructure readiness and hardware as well as open data sharing platforms in support of MUO development. While Rakan Pintar is a stakeholder that supplies and uses data through the MUO platform.
faq.A713: Malaysian Administration Modernization and Management Planning Unit (MAMPU)
faq.Q8: Can I use the MUO system without registering as a registered user ?
faq.A8: Nope. Public users need to register as a registered user in the MUO system.
faq.Q9: How long does it take to activate a registered account ?
faq.A9: The account activation period is within 5 days and the registration status notification is via email by the System Administrator.

searchFilter.SearchPH: Examples of searches such as residences, facilities, industries, institutions and so on.
searchFilter.content1: The gazetted area as well as the built-up saturated area bordering it and the combination of these two areas has a population of 10,000 or more; or *area specialized development; or district administration center though population less than 10,000 people and at least 60% of its population aged 15 and above are involved in non-agricultural activities.
